General transport functions
	General transport duty
		The Assembly must—
			develop policies for the promotion and encouragement of safe, integrated,sustainable, efficient and economic transport facilities and services to, fromand within Wales, and
			carry out its functions so as to implement those policies.
		The transport facilities and services mentioned in subsection (1) are—
			those required to meet the needs of persons living or working in Wales, orvisiting or travelling through Wales, and
			those required for the transportation of freight.
		Those facilities and services include facilities and services forpedestrians and cyclists.
	Wales Transport Strategy
		The Assembly must prepare and publish a document to be known as the WalesTransport Strategy.
		The Strategy must set out—
			the policies developed by the Assembly under section 1(1)(a), and
			how the Assembly proposes to discharge its duty under section 1(1)(b).
		The Assembly must keep the Strategy under review and may from time to timerevise it.
		If the Assembly revises the Strategy, it must publish (as it considersappropriate)—
			the whole Strategy as revised, or
			the revised parts.
		In preparing or revising the Strategy the Assembly must consult—
			each local authority in Wales;
			each county council or district council in England whose area abuts Wales;
			any other persons it considers appropriate.
		The Strategy and any revision of it do not have effect until approved bythe Assembly.
		The Assembly must not delegate its function under subsection (6).
Local transport functions
	Local transport plans
		The Schedule (which makes provision about local transport plans) has effect.
	Arrangements for discharge of transport functions
		The Assembly may direct two or more local authorities in Wales to enterinto arrangements—
			in the terms specified in the direction, and
			in relation to the discharge of transport functions specified in thedirection.
		The arrangements may in particular be or include arrangements for the jointdischarge of transport functions.
		In deciding whether to give a direction under this section in relation toparticular functions, the Assembly must in particular have regard to theinterests of economy, efficiency and effectiveness in the discharge of thefunctions.
		The Assembly may vary or revoke a direction given under this section inrelation to particular functions by a further such direction, but only if itis satisfied that, on variation or revocation, satisfactory arrangements willbe in place for the discharge of those functions.
		Before giving, varying or revoking a direction under this section theAssembly must consult the local authorities concerned and any other persons itconsiders appropriate.
		“Transport function” means a function of a local authority in Walesrelating to transport.
	Joint transport authorities
		The Assembly may by order establish a body (to be known as a jointtransport authority) to discharge specified transport functions for an areamade up of all or any part or parts of the areas of two or more specifiedlocal authorities in Wales.
		Before making an order under subsection (1) the Assembly must consult thelocal authorities concerned and any other persons it considers appropriate.
		A joint transport authority must be established as a body corporate.
		An order under subsection (1) may include provision—
			about the composition of the joint transport authority (including theappointment of members of the authority by the local authorities concerned andby the Assembly);
			about the proceedings of the authority (including different provision inrespect of the voting rights of different categories of member);
			about the financing of the authority;
			about the discharge of the functions of the authority (including provisionfor the discharge of functions by committees);
			about officers of the authority;
			about the acquisition, appropriation and disposal of land by the authority(including provision for the acquisition of land by agreement orcompulsorily);
			for the transfer of staff, property, rights and liabilities to theauthority;
			for the payment of compensation in respect of loss suffered by any personin consequence of the constitution of the authority;
			for specified enactments relating to local authorities in Wales andtransport functions to have effect, in relation to the authority and itsfunctions, with any specified modifications.
		If an order under subsection (1) includes provision for the appointment ofmembers of the authority by persons other than the local authoritiesconcerned, the order must not provide for the total number of members soappointed to be equal to, or exceed, half the total number of members capableof being appointed.
		The Assembly may vary or revoke an order under subsection (1) only if it issatisfied that, on variation or revocation, satisfactory arrangements will bein place for the discharge of the functions of the joint transport authority.
		An order varying or revoking an order under subsection (1) may includeprovision for the transfer of staff, property, rights and liabilities from thejoint transport authority to one or more other joint transport authorities orlocal authorities in Wales.
		Before varying or revoking an order under subsection (1) the Assembly mustconsult—
			any joint transport authorities and local authorities in Wales which appearto it likely to be affected;
			any other persons it considers appropriate.
		An order under subsection (1) is to be treated as being Assembly generalsubordinate legislation for the purposes of the Government of Wales Act [1998(c. 38)](/id/ukpga/1998/38?view=plain "Go to item of legislation").
		For the purposes of section 74 of the Local Government Finance Act [1988(c. 41)](/id/ukpga/1988/41?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (levies)—
			a joint transport authority is to be treated as a levying body with respectto which regulations may be made under subsection (2) of that section, and
			the reference in that subsection to the council concerned is to be treatedas a reference to the local authorities specified in the order undersubsection (1) establishing the joint transport authority.
		In this section—
			  * “specified”, in relation to an order under subsection (1), means specified in the order; 
			  * “transport function” means a function of a local authority in Wales relating to transport. 
	Financial assistance: local transport functions
		The Assembly may give financial assistance to—
			joint transport authorities, and
			local authorities in Wales,
				for the purpose of enabling or facilitating them to discharge their functionsrelating to transport.
		The Assembly may attach conditions to financial assistance under thissection.
Public transport
	Provision of public passenger transport services
		The Assembly may secure the provision of any public passenger transportservices which it considers appropriate for the purpose of meeting any publictransport requirements within Wales which would not in its view otherwise bemet.
		In exercising its power under subsection (1) the Assembly must have regardto—
			a combination of economy, efficiency and effectiveness,
			the Wales Transport Strategy, and
			the transport needs of members of the public who are elderly or disabled.
		For the purpose of securing the provision of a service under subsection (1)the Assembly may enter into agreements providing for service subsidies.
		But the Assembly may not enter into an agreement under subsection (3)unless the service in question would not be provided without a subsidy.
		“Public passenger transport services” means all those services on whichmembers of the public rely for getting from place to place, when not relyingon private facilities of their own, including school transport but notincluding—
			services provided under permits under section 19 of the Transport Act [1985(c. 67)](/id/ukpga/1985/67?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (permits inrelation to use of buses by educational and other bodies) other than servicesprovided wholly or mainly to meet the needs of members of the public who areelderly or disabled;
			excursions or tours.
		“Agreements providing for service subsidies” are agreements under which anyperson undertakes to provide public passenger transport services of anydescription on terms which include provision for the making of payments tothat person by the Assembly.
		“Excursion or tour” has the meaning given in section 137(1) of theTransport Act [1985 (c. 67)](/id/ukpga/1985/67?view=plain "Go to item oflegislation").
	Public Transport Users' Committee for Wales
		The Assembly may by order establish a body corporate, to be known as thePublic Transport Users' Committee for Wales or Pwyllgor DefnyddwyrTrafnidiaeth Gyhoeddus Cymru.
		The Assembly may by order provide for a body established under subsection(1) to be known by a different name.
		A body established under subsection (1) is referred to in this Act as theCommittee.
		An order under subsection (1) may include provision—
			about the status and membership of the Committee (including how members areto be appointed);
			about the proceedings of the Committee;
			about officers and staff of the Committee;
			about the discharge of functions of the Committee (including provision forthe discharge of functions by sub-committees with members who are not allmembers of the Committee);
			about the making of reports by the Committee to the Assembly;
			about the making of payments to or in respect of officers, staff andmembers of the Committee;
			about the payment of pensions and the making of other payments to or inrespect of former officers and staff of the Committee;
			about the keeping of accounts by the Committee and their audit andsubmission to the Assembly;
			about the acquisition and disposal by the Committee of property, rights andliabilities (including land);
			authorising the Committee to charge for any services it provides in thedischarge of any of its functions;
			for the transfer of staff, property, rights and liabilities to theCommittee.
		The Assembly may make payments to the Committee of such amounts, at suchtimes, and on such conditions (if any) as it considers appropriate.
		The Assembly may by order make provision for the transfer of staff,property, rights and liabilities from the Committee to any other person.
	Functions of the Committee
		The Committee may consider and make recommendations to the Assembly aboutany matter relating to public passenger transport services or facilities to,from or within Wales.
		The Committee must consider and make recommendations to the Assembly aboutany such matter if asked to do so by the Assembly.
		The Assembly may by order—
			confer further functions on the Committee;
			remove functions from the Committee;
			make changes to any functions of the Committee;
			transfer any functions of the Committee to another person (including to theAssembly).
		An order under subsection (3) may confer a function on the Committee, ormake changes to a function of the Committee, only if the new function, or thefunction as changed, relates to public passenger transport services orfacilities to, from or within Wales.
		The functions that may be conferred on the Committee under subsection(3)(a) include a power—
			to enter into arrangements with another body for discharging functions onbehalf of that body in relation to Wales;
			to give effect to any such arrangements;
			to enter into arrangements with another body for that body to discharge anyfunctions of the Committee on behalf of the Committee.
		The discharge of a function by the Committee on behalf of another body doesnot affect the responsibility of the body for the discharge of the function.
		The discharge of a function by another body on behalf of the Committee doesnot affect the responsibility of the Committee for the discharge of thefunction.
		The provision that may be made in an order under subsection (3) includesprovision amending or repealing any provision of an enactment conferringfunctions on the Committee.
		The Committee may do anything which is calculated to facilitate, or isconducive or incidental to, the discharge of any of its functions.
		In this section—
			  * “public passenger transport services” has the meaning given in section 7; 
			  * “public passenger transport facilities” means facilities for public passenger transport services. 
	Guidance and directions to the Committee
		The Assembly may—
			issue guidance to the Committee as to how it is to discharge its functions;
			give directions to the Committee as to how it is to discharge itsfunctions.
		The Committee must—
			have regard to any guidance issued under subsection (1)(a);
			comply with any directions given under subsection (1)(b).
		Guidance or directions under this section must be in writing.
		The Assembly may vary or revoke directions given under this section.
Air transport
	Financial assistance: air transport services
		The Assembly may give financial assistance to—
			persons who provide or propose to provide air transport services whichstart or end at an airport in Wales, and
			persons who provide or propose to provide airport facilities or services ata place in Wales,
				for the purpose of enabling or facilitating them to provide those services orfacilities.
		But the Assembly may give financial assistance under this section only ifthe services or facilities would not in its view be provided without thefinancial assistance.
		The Assembly may attach conditions to financial assistance under thissection.
		“Air transport services” means services for the carriage by air ofpassengers or cargo.
Supplementary
	Commencement 
		The preceding provisions of this Act come into force in accordance withprovision made by the Assembly by order.
	Orders 
		This section applies to an order made by the Assembly under this Act.
		The power to make the order is exercisable by statutory instrument.
		The order—
			may make different provision for different purposes;
			may include incidental, supplemental, consequential, saving or transitionalprovision.
	Interpretation 
		This section applies for the purposes of this Act.
		“The Assembly” means the National Assembly for Wales.
		“Local authority in Wales” means a county council or county borough councilin Wales.
	Money 
		There shall be paid out of money provided by Parliament any increaseattributable to this Act in the sums payable out of money provided byParliament under another enactment.
	Extent 
		This Act extends to England and Wales only.
	Short title
		This Act may be cited as the Transport (Wales) Act 2006.
